title: Drawing, "Chandelier", late 18th century
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, ruled border in pen and brown ink, green wash on paper
inscribed: Inscribed at top center in pen and brown ink: Disegno per Lampadaro Nobille guarnito con Sei / Gruppi da Numo 5, Lumi, e No 4 Lampadari
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a chandelier.  The chandelier comprises of four sections.  Above, suspended on a vine branch with stick, two vases, alternative suggestions, with a ring for candles.  Chains and pendants of crystal.  These and the candles are in general only drawn of the right half.  Suspended, with a cord, above a knob.  The edges are colored dark olive with inside a border line.  Inscription in the upper part of the sheet

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Chandelier", late 18th century.
late 18th century. Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, ruled border in pen and brown ink, green wash on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-563.
